duck: A methyltransferase also known as a methylase  is a type of transferase enzyme that transfers a methyl group from a donor to an acceptor.
any of a group of enzymes that catalyze the transfer of a methyl group from one compound to another.
A methyltransferase also known as a methylase  is a type of transferase enzyme that transfers a methyl group from a donor to an acceptor.

 ]] A 'methyltransferase' also known as a 'methylase' is a type of transferase
 enzyme that transfers a methyl group from a donor to an acceptor.

Methylation often occurs on nucleic bases in DNA or amino acids in protein
structures. Methytransferases use a reactive methyl group bound to sulfur in S-
adenosyl methionine (SAM) as the methyl donor.
wiki.title: Methyltransferase
